perturbation.original_text: Section 5.3 Term and Termination. This Agreement is effective on the Effective Date and shah continue in effect until the earlier of (a) the fifth (5t h) anniversary of the Effective Date, and (b) termination by either Party for any reason upon thirty (30) days' written notice to the other Party; provided, however, that no Party shall be able to terminate this Agreement so long as such Party is a Defaulting Party under this Agreement. The occurrence of the Termination Date shall not relieve either Party of any unfulfilled obligation or undischarged liability of such Party relating to the period prior to the Termination Date.

perturbation.original_text: Section 4.4 Return of Confidential Information. The Recipient agrees that upon the written request of the disclosing Party it will promptly (a) return all Confidential Information and any and all copies thereof to the disclosing Party and shall require each of its Affiliate to do likewise or (b) destroy the same and deliver a certificate of destruction to the disclosing Party.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4.4 Return of Confidential Information. perturbation.explanation: Delaying the return or destruction of confidential information until 90 days after termination creates a contradiction. English law emphasizes the immediate protection of trade secrets and confidential information. A delay of 90 days could expose the disclosing party to undue risk and potential damages, thus contradicting the principle of immediate protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of immediate protection of trade secrets and confidential information under English law.
